@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Mixin for the linear background gradient CSS property. This mixin is usually used by {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}. Keep in mind that this is not supported by all browsers:

  • Safari 4.0+
  • Chrome 4.0+
  • Firefox 3.6+
  • Opera 11.1+
  • IE 10+

  • IE 5.5+ (with limitations) For IE 5.5 to IE 8,this class uses the filter rules to create the gradient. This has some limitations: The start and end position property can not be used. For more details, see the original documentation: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms532997(v=vs.85).aspx For IE9, we create a gradient in a canvas element and render this gradient as background image. Due to restrictions in the background-image css property, we can not allow negative start values in that case. It is possible to define multiple background gradients by setting an array containing the needed values as the property value. In case multiple values are specified, the values of the properties are repeated until all match in length. It is not possible to define multiple background gradients when falling back to filter rules (IE5.5 to IE8). An example:

   'my-decorator': {
     style: {
       startColor:['rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)', 'rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.5)', 'rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)'],
       endColor: 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)',
       orientation: ['horizontal', 'vertical']
     }
   }

which is the same as: 

   'my-decorator': {
     style: {
       startColor: ['rgba(255, 0, 0, 0.5)', 'rgba(0, 255, 0, 0.5)', 'rgba(0, 0, 255, 0.5)'],
       endColor: ['rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)', 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)', 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.2)'],
       orientation: ['horizontal', 'vertical', 'horizontal']
     }
   }

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Start color of the background gradient. Note that alpha transparency (rgba) is not supported in IE 8.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: End color of the background gradient. Note that alpha transparency (rgba) is not supported in IE 8.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The orientation of the gradient.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Position in percent where to start the color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Position in percent where to start the color.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Defines if the given positions are in % or px.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to set the start color including its start position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Property group to set the end color including its end position.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Takes a styles map and adds the linear background styles in place to the given map. This is the needed behavior for {@link qx.ui.decoration.Decorator}.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: styles {Map} A map to add the styles.
@param.description: A map to add the styles.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Compute CSS rules to style the background with gradients. This can be called multiple times and SHOULD layer the gradients on top of each other and on top of existing backgrounds. Legacy implementation for old WebKit browsers (Chrome < 10).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: startColor {Color} The color to start the gradient with
@param.description: The color to start the gradient with

@param.name: @param
@param.body: endColor {Color} The color to end the gradient with
@param.description: The color to end the gradient with

@param.name: @param
@param.body: unit {Color} The unit in which startColorPosition and endColorPosition are measured
@param.description: The unit in which startColorPosition and endColorPosition are measured

@param.name: @param
@param.body: orientation {String} Either 'horizontal' or 'vertical'
@param.description: Either 'horizontal' or 'vertical'

@param.name: @param
@param.body: startColorPosition {Number} The position of the gradient’s starting point, measured in unit units along the orientation axis from top or left
@param.description: The position of the gradient’s starting point, measured in unit units along the orientation axis from top or left

@param.name: @param
@param.body: endColorPosition {Number} The position of the gradient’s ending point, measured in unit units along the orientation axis from top or left
@param.description: The position of the gradient’s ending point, measured in unit units along the orientation axis from top or left

@param.name: @param
@param.body: styles {Map} The complete styles currently poised to be applied by decorators. Should not be written to in this method (use backgroundStyle for that)
@param.description: The complete styles currently poised to be applied by decorators. Should not be written to in this method (use backgroundStyle for that)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: backgroundStyle {Map} This method should push new background styles onto this array.
@param.description: This method should push new background styles onto this array.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} Whether this implementation supports multiple gradients atop each other (true).
@return.description: Whether this implementation supports multiple gradients atop each other (true).

@param.description: The complete styles currently poised to be applied by decorators. Should not be written to in this method (use backgroundStyle for that). Note: this particular implementation will do that because it needs to change the filter property.

@param.description: This method should push new background styles onto this array.

@return.name: @return

@return.description: Whether this implementation supports multiple gradients atop each other (false).

@description.name: @description

@description.name: @description

@param.description: The color name

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property startColor. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #startColor}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property startColor. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #startColor}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property startColor. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #startColor}.
